means: <英>两星期（发生、出现）一次的[地]，每两周的[地]

sentence.Network_en: They recently put my rent up and I pay it fortnightly.
sentence.Network_cn: 他们最近涨了租金，我就每两周付一次房租。

sentence.Network_en: Unemployment benefit is paid fortnightly in arrears.
sentence.Network_cn: 失业救济金延后两个星期支付。

sentence.Network_en: Meetings take place at fortnightly intervals.

list.abs: 对地月系而言,第一、二、三项引起的潮汐分别称为半月潮(FORTNIGHTLY TIDE)、半日潮(SEMIDIURNAL TIDE)和每日潮(DIURNAL TIDE).值得注意的是,半月潮对时间平均后.

entry.tran: 每两周的;两星期一次的;隔周发行的
entry.def: A fortnightly event or publication happens or appears once every two weeks.

example.ex: They are now holding their fortnightly meetings at The New Invention Victory Club.
example.tran: 他们现在正在新发明胜利俱乐部开两周一次的例会。
令人激动的新发行的双周刊
